bill_title: create a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program within the State of South Dakota. The purpose of the program is to negotiate the purchase of prescription drugs to be offered at a reduced cost to the eligible participants. The program shall be open to any resident of the state who is age sixty-five and older and any person meeting the eligibility criteria for a disability as defined in Title XVIII of the Social Security Amendments of 1965 as amended to January 1, 2003. Section 2. The program shall be administered by the Bureau of Personnel. The commissioner of personnel may enter into agreements with private entities and cooperate with other local, state, or federal agencies to implement the purposes of the program. The commissioner may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 necessary to facilitate such agreements. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Health and Human Services Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program within the State of South Dakota. The purpose of the program is to negotiate the purchase of prescription drugs to be offered at a reduced cost to the eligible participants. The program shall be open to any resident of the state who is age sixty-five and older and any person meeting the eligibility criteria for a disability as defined in Title II of the Social Security Amendments of 1954 as amended to January 1, 2003, excluding those persons eligible for benefits under Title XIX. Section 2. The program shall be administered by the Bureau of Personnel. The commissioner of personnel may enter into agreements with private entities and cooperate with other local, state, or federal agencies to implement the purposes of the program. The commissioner shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 regarding various discounts and incentives on the purchase of pharmaceuticals by or for participating members and regarding dispensing and intervention fees. Section 3. The Bureau of Personnel may contract to create a preferred drug list and negotiate pharmaceutical prices for the benefit of participating members and pharmacies. Section 4. The provisions of this Act are repealed July 1, 2005.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created a senior citizen prescription drug benefit program within the State of South Dakota. The purpose of the program is to negotiate the purchase of prescription drugs to be offered at a reduced cost to the eligible participants. The program shall be open to any resident of the state who is age sixty-five and older and any person meeting the eligibility criteria for a disability as defined in Title II of the Social Security Amendments of 1954 as amended to January 1, 2003, excluding those persons eligible for benefits under Title XIX. Section 2. The program shall be administered by the Bureau of Personnel. The commissioner of personnel may enter into agreements with private entities and cooperate with other local, state, or federal agencies to implement the purposes of the program. The commissioner shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 regarding various discounts on the purchase of pharmaceuticals for participating members and regarding dispensing and intervention fees. Section 3. The Bureau of Personnel may contract to create a preferred drug list and negotiate pharmaceutical prices for the benefit of participating members and pharmacies. Section 4. The provisions of this Act are repealed July 1, 2005. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
